page.title: 03HEALTH CARE IN CHURCHDOWN
page.content: IN CHURCHDOWN THERE ARE 2 HEALTH VISITORS AND 1 SCHOOL NURSE. THEY WORK FOR THE HEALTH AUTHORITY AND ARE BASED AT GLOUCESTER ROYAL HOSPITAL. THE SCHOOL NURSE CARES FOR THE HEALTH OF CHILDREN IN 12 SCHOOLS WHICH IS APROX. 3000 CHILDREN BETWEEN THE AGE OF 5 TO 18. ON AVERAGE SHE VISITS 8 SCHOOLS A WEEK. WHEN SHE VISITS PRIMARY SCHOOLS SHE INSPECTS THE CHILDREN'S HAIR AND PERSONAL HYGIENE. SHE TRAVELS IN HER OWN CAR AND WORKS WITH DOCTORS, HEALTH VISITORS, SCHOOL STAFF, SOCIAL SECURTY STAFF AND PHYSIOTHERAPISTS. THE HEALTH VISITORS VISIT PATIENTS WHO ATTEND ST. JOHNS SURGERY. THEY CARE MOSTLY FOR THE YOUNG AND OLD OF THE COMMUNITY. IN YOUNG CHILDREN THEY CHECK DEVELOPMENTAL SKILLS AND RECORD ON COMPUTERS IMPORTANT INFORMATION SUCH AS ILLNESSES AND VACCINATIONS.
